title: How Typhoon Hagibis will throw the Rugby World Cup schedule into chaos
text:
Typhoon Hagibis is wreaking havoc across the 2019 Rugby World Cup. Players, coaches, fans and tournament officials have had their plans ruined by the scheduled 150mph winds which are expected to hit the wider Tokyo area by this weekend.

The Japanese Metrological Agency has described Typhoon Hagibis as "violent" with the capacity to cause widespread destruction around the Tokyo region.

Which games are affected?

The high-profile casualties for this weekend are the England vs France match and the New Zealand vs Italy fixture. Both games have been called off with the match being declared a draw meaning two points for each side. This decision from World Rugby ensures that England top Pool C with...
description: Typhoon Hagibis is wreaking havoc across the 2019 Rugby World Cup.
